imes 
the process of softening 
can take many hours before 
what midwives refer to as 
‘established labour’. This is 
when your cervix has dilated 
to at least 4cm.
If you go into hospital or your 
midwifery unit before labour 
is established, you may be 
asked if you would prefer to go 
home again for a while, rather 
than spending extra hours in 
hospital. If you go home, you 
should make sure that you 
eat and drink, as you will need 
energy. At night, try to get 
comfortable.
 
Get some slee
